intro: Coccoloba caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas beauty or Caribbean beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble a hand with five fingers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its attractive foliage and resilience.
